Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ristoggyvbknknj
Reviews.Content: hotel needs refurbishment. bed and overall impression ok. room needs proper cleaning. it is not dirty dirty, but somewhat carelessly cleaned. great location on quiet street. I paid 24â‚¬ per night, so despite some faults good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: tatyana90
Reviews.Content: We stay in this hotel with husband for a week, and from this trip we have only good impression. Hotel has exellent location in Sultanahmet area, we were not need to by taxi much, all near - Aya Sofya,Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc... all that tourists needs :) shops, restorants, souvenirs, nice places.. Comfortable rooms, nice interior, cleaning service good and in time. Breakfast in traditional turkish style, testy and varied. Stuff very friendly, benevolent and helpful. we spent great time in Istanbul and in Asmali hotel, and will recommend to all who want to spend holidays in romantic place in the heart of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Quaint Sultanhamet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worktotravel14
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful stay in this hotel. Booked this hotel day of and stayed in two different rooms over 4 days. The rooms were very clean and all had nice bedding, decent towels, and essential toiletries and amenities. They even had plug adapters for us Americans, making it an extra nice perk. I also thought the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. They offered lots of advice and suggestions about how to get around. As travelers who like nice accommodations during the even, but tend to budget, they did not try to oversell us on tours or experience tourist attractions. The breakfast was really nice -- a traditional Turkish buffet with a mixture of meats, olives, cheeses, eggs, breads and pastries, and other varieties of tasty treats. On nice days you can go upstairs to enjoy a view of the city. The hotel is very convenient to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and other attractions that are close by, but you need to travel a little further to get to the heart of the restaurant districts or other parts of town. For us, it was ideal, because we got a little walk in a we got to indulge in more Turkish treats.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy Room”
Reviews.Author: tolarjev
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights over the Internet. Not bad, just inferior to the other 2 hotels where I later stayed in Istanbul (Sebnem & Dara). It was maybe $25 cheaper than the others, but the other two were worth $50 more IMO. Our room faced a brick wall & so was dark & gloomy. I guess we didn't interact with the staff enough to have any particular feeling except that they were doing their jobs but not knocking themselves out to be helpful (unlike the other 2 hotels I just mentioned). It was kind of hard to find this particular location although it is close to major attractions. I get lost all the time & in 2 days barely got the hang of where this street was.

Reviews.Title: “It lets you down...”
Reviews.Author: YiorgosFinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a doudle room for 6 nights but for the first night we forced to stay in a smelly basement room due to maintance works on the hydraulic system of the room we had booked (as the receptioned mentioned to us). It is a hotel that needs another refurbisment right now although it has gone through that in 2007 (as they claim). Photos on internet site that advertise the hotel do not meet your expectations when you actually visit the hotel. Poor breakfast, small roof terrace with no sunshades and flowers, badly-preserved hotel with no elavator and without soundproof consist the main drawbacks of Asmali hotel. There is no restaurant and bar as well. I found expired coffee sticks in my room, broken chair, broken electrical plug-ins. Also, It is not recommended for elderly people. On the other hand it has a great location, near to the main sight-seeings, but difficult to find it. Overall, you can find better hotels at the area of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “A little difficult to find, but walking distance to lots of stuff”
Reviews.Author: beeeechbum
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of a difficult time finding our hotel, but once we did everything was great. We stayed in the basement room which was fine. The bed wasn't terribly comfortable, but it wasn't awful either. The complimentary daily breakfast was pretty good, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is walking distance to many sights in Sultanahment as well as public transportation to get to other parts of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: londontown21
Reviews.Content: we booked through last minute where the hotel was described as having a bar with a good range of beers/wines and a rooftop restaurant. It has neither. It serves a buffet breakfast, and has a small rooftop terrace which you can walk up to with 4 tables and chairs. The buffet breakfast is fine, so are the rooms and the staff it's just misrepresented.

Reviews.Title: “On the nose”
Reviews.Author: Shirenomads
Reviews.Content: Asmali - a-smelly. The bathroom had an unpleasant odour and not from our occupation of it. My wife describes it as a musty or damp smell. I think that's being generous. Not sure but there may also have been bedbugs. Great location though. Just around the corner from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Aircon was a plus. Wifi in the room and friendly staff also took the edge off the dissatisfaction with the bathroom. We would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great character, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DavidCleveland
Reviews.Content: The location is great - within easy walking distance of the top historic and tourist attractions of Istanbul. The Hotel has character - it is an old restored house in the old part of Istanbul, but seems to have been restored or renovated quite recently - things inside look new. It has the friendly feel of a Bed & Breakfast establishment. You can eat breakfast in a very pleasant setting on the roof of the building with a great view over parts of Istanbul and the Sea of Marmara. The beds were comfortable and everything in the room worked fine. The staff were very friendly and cooperative. I would try and stay there again if I get back to Istanbul. The staircase was a bit poky and the lighting on the staircase was a bit dodgy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality and Location”
Reviews.Author: amanthind
Reviews.Content: Asmali hotel made our trip! The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was one of the best with warm milk served for tea that was hard to find elsewhere. The location was the best possible as all the top places of interest like Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar are 5 minutes of leisurely walk away. But an even greater highlight was the amazingly hospitable staff. We were on a 6 day stopover trip with only 2 days in Istanbul carrying 4 large suitcases and Mr Sadik on hearing our travel plans himself offered to store our luggage for us free of charge while we went touring the rest of Turkey. That was one big problem for us solved in less than 2 mins of checking in. As if that wasn't enough, when we returned to pick our bags after taking an overnight bus from Cappadocia and with a few hours to spare for our flight, he offered us breakfast and a room to freshen up and rest and later even refused to take any payment for that. Then he arranged our airport transfer and by the time we stepped out of the room, our bags were already loaded. I have travelled the world but never seen this level of hospitality or personal care and attention to the clients. I think it is that what makes Asmali hotel the best place to stay in Istanbul. One tip: If you stop here make sure you ask Mr Sadik to show you the place he gets his daily bread from. It was warm, crispy and better than any bread we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, nothing was too much bother”
Reviews.Author: Cyntheap
Reviews.Content: The Asmali Hotel was a lovely change from many of the experiences that we had in Istanbul, mostly because of the outstanding service of the staff. They were very friendly, spoke enough English to communicate pleasantly, arranged tours for us at short notice and interestingly let us view 3 rooms of very similar price and choose our favourite. The rooms were not very large but the bed was incredibly comfortable and there was lots of natural light. The complimentary breakfast was a nice spread of east and west. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. The tram is on the other side of the Blue Mosque and is an excellent way to get around all of Istanbul's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterUni86
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. On the homepage it said it is a new hotel from 2007 but it looks run down, not new at all. The room was very, very dirty it seemed they never cleaned it. I complained and the next morning they cleaned the bathroom but they did not clean the room itself since I had so much dust on my socks. The staff was really polite and the breakfast was good. All in all I would not recommend this hotel since you can get much better hotels for the same price. It is very easy to reach the main attraction by public transport so don t worry about getting a hotel next to the blue mosque since they are over priced and their money not worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: ss518
Reviews.Content: Having booked on lastminute, we were not assigned a room till check in. For the first two nights, we got the room on the top floor. Great room, with a queen size bed. for the last night we were given the basement twin room. A big change from the one upstairs. It was quite stuffy and the bathroom smelt a bit funny. This aside, the hotel is in a great location a stone throw away from the Blue Mosque and the Sultanahmet area. The staff were very friendly. They booked us a very comfortable taxi back to the airport. It cost 20 euros for the 2 of us and is much better than the local taxis. Over all a great stay and can definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and a real Turkish feel.”
Reviews.Author: Mattw1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Asmali mid last year, so apologies for the delayed review. In short, wonderful value for a stylish, clean hotel, with good food and very friendly and helpful staff. Location-wise its perfect....stones throw from all the fun stuff. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city break location!”
Reviews.Author: Gloggy
Reviews.Content: We went here for our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is off the main road and quietly located on a stones throw away from the Blue Mosque. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room (Asmali Mansion Room) was spacious and good working air conditioning. TV was a bit on the small side especially since it was on the other side of the room but to be honest why would one need a TV in this city! Bathroom was clean and the bath and shower were working well. Breakfast was good enough to get going and it was nice to be able to sit on the roof terrace, though you had to navigate the steep steps up to the roof. We had a wonderful stay at the hotel for 3 nights. Unfortunately there was some building work happening next door. It did not cause us much grief as most of the day we were out anyway. Just hope the character of the area does not get damaged, but that is unfortunately not in the hands of the capable staff of the hotel. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “we felt like it was home away from home”
Reviews.Author: robinleerose
Reviews.Content: Enis the day manager (as well as other staff members) went out of their way on numerous occasÄ±ons to assÄ±st us and we dÄ±d have some really serious Ä±ssues. FÄ±rst - the ATM machÄ±ne kept our ATM card. He and the staff assÄ±sted us Ä±n makÄ±ng all of the needed phone calls both local and back to USA. Lesson learned... use ATM machÄ±nes insÄ±de of a bank wÄ±th bank offÄ±cials assÄ±stance. Second, my husband experÄ±enced severe kidney stone pain about 8 days into our stay. Again we were assÄ±sted wÄ±th arrangements to the AmerÄ±can HospÄ±tal for emergency treatment. Enis referred us to Backpackers Travel Agent frÄ±end (Yusuf) and we booked several travel plans whÄ±ch worked out beautÄ±fully for our 2 additional weeks of travels in Turkey. The breakfast room was neat, clean, and food good. We had our laundry done, good servÄ±ce with that too. All in all we loved the place wÄ±th the small home lÄ±ke ATTITUDE. R&D Rose, DublÄ±n OHIO USA

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager”
Reviews.Author: AsserM
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Amail hotel tonigth. All beds are only 190 cm long and kingsize beds are 140 wide :-), if you, as me, are 197, it is just too bad!!! Good service upon arraival but the general Manager Mr. Enis Alpaytac was simply rude. He was yelling and threatening me when I kindly asked for a madras for the floor. When I asked him to talk nice to me he yelled â€œGo away from the hotel, Go away now. This is our hotel and you are not to tell me how to talk"!!! I have around 120 travel days per year and I NEVER experienced anything like that before!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You canÂ´t find better hotel personel from Istanbul than in Asmali!”
Reviews.Author: Valonsade
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Asmali Hotel almost two weeks during December 2010 - January 2011 and wouldnÂ´t changed a day! The top floor rooms are roomy, beautiful and and very Istanbul in a good way. The breakfast is good and the view from roof terrace is amazing! You should definetely enjoy your morning coffee there! But the best thing in Asmali is the personel! So many thanks to Enes and the rest of the staff for making our holiday perfect! If we go to Istanbul again some day, weÂ´ll absolutely book Asmali again! And I would recommend let the Asmali handle your ride from the Airport to the hotel, cause they use very good company for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good service - Can improve more”
Reviews.Author: A_K_Nayyar
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience to stay at Asmali hotel, Generally the staff was good and co operative specially Mr Enis and Ms Fatima. The heating in the room was really good. They should provide some help in handling luggage for the family specially as the building do not have the lift. The room had the DVD player and satellite TV, the TV quality can be improved. Overall it was good and I recommend others to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Stolli03
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in Sultanahmet, near most of the main sights. Staff were great... very helpful and had lots of handy advice about Istanbul. Easy walk to tram stop, so also easy to get to from airport. Our room was a little small and musty but overall comfortable. Included breakfast was good. Would probably stay there again based on location and room rate.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: THIS HOTEL HAS A SERIOUS MOLD PROBLEM...”
Reviews.Author: Volkolas
Reviews.Content: The management knows about it but the owner seems to not care enough to do anything to address the issue. If you have a sensitivity to mold do not stay here. Mold issues notwithstanding, I wanted to write a very fair, honest account of the Asmali Hotel and their friendly, hardworking management staff. Unfortunately, I also have to agree with others who have written reviews here about the Asmali and expressed disappointment at this hotel after so many glowing reports. We stayed at the Asmali for 1 week, end of September 2010. The location is decent but the immediate neighborhood is not particularly charming or even attractive (see Alex_Jei review, Jan 7. 2010). There is a roof top terrace which is reasonably clean, though there is random clutter thatÂ´s kept in one corner thatÂ´s a real eye-sore. There is a semi-obstructed view of the Blue Mosque that faces the building and on the other side there is quite a nice view of the Sea of Marmara (You can also see clearly the roof top terraces of those who have spent a little more for their accommodations than you have...!). The hotel is essentially kept clean and the rooms have a/c and mini fridge but the walls are thin (easy to hear neighbors) and the doors are made of some sort of fortified plastic, not wood, and at night the motion sensors on the staircase activate at the absolute last moment, just nanoseconds before you think youÂ´re going to plunge head first down the staircase. The shower in our room defied basic principles of both logic and design: No shower door, water goes all over the bathroom and pools on the floor. Breakfast is OK but you donÂ´t have to look too hard to see that a minimal effort is made and that corners are regularly cut. None of the fruit juices are fresh, everythingÂ´s canned, or worse. Some of the Turkish specialties served at breakfast are tasty but the breakfast, like the hotel, is unremarkable and basically needs an overhaul. The two managers of the hotel were very friendly and try to be helpful, but some of the ones working in the late evening had very limited English skills and didnÂ´t really seem to want to make an effort to understand what we were asking. Overall assessment: If you have a sensitivity to mold, DO NOT STAY HERE; if you do not have a sensitivity to mold, and are looking for a good location in Sultanahmet thatÂ´s basically clean, in a quiet neighborhood, with a roof top terrace with a nice view, AND costs less than 100 euros per night, then you might like the Asmali. If youÂ´re looking for anything more than that, IÂ´d say this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123walker
Reviews.Content: i have been to the asmali hotel for 12 nights. overall i can recommend the hotel price/value is really good. the location is perfect all the sights in the old city of istanbul are in walking distance. the staff is helpfull. good breakfast and a nice terrase. things to improve: rooms should be cleaned if you stay for 12 nights. we had to stay in a basement room for the first night allthough we booked a normal room. the basement room is not acceptabel and not very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location and a Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: Meero
Reviews.Content: I was at Asmali Hotel last week during a stopover in Istanbul along with my wife and an infant. We stayed three nights and got a superb deal by mailing the hotel directly. Hotel is nicely located near heart of old city. It was just a five minute walk to major historical sites like Hagias Sofia, Blue Mosque etc. Staff is so much friendly, especially Enis, great guy with a big smile on his face all the time. Everyone was so helpful. Enis planned my whole trip for three days and checked all timings for various Museums and ferries. Our Standard double room was quite comfortable and spacious. It got all facilities like mini bar, TV, AC, telephone. Breakfast was very delicious and in abundance. Though served on top floor, roof top access gives perfect panoramic view of blue mosque and clear Blue Ocean. As I was travelling with an infant in a stroller, only disadvantage was that we have to walk uphill for 10 minutes to access tram. For couples and single travelers I think this is a perfect launching pad for the beautiful and majestic city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a stunning location”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamer61
Reviews.Content: You can't go past this family run hotel. Great value for money, it has oodles of character and is right in the heart of the Sultanahment with the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Haga Sofia etc right on your doorstep. Stunning location. Superb breakfasts provided upstairs on the rooftop-overlooking old Istanbul. Our room was clean, tidy with an ensuite, airconditioner and fridge. We had a small basement room but I did peek in other rooms which were much larger, so consider that when you book. The staff were really great and couldn't do enough for us. We would stay in this hotel again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: halamdarii
Reviews.Content: It was our 3rd trip to Istanbul and it was the most satisfing hotel we exprienced. The most welcomming things for us were: 1) Friendly people in reception and service. 2) Great location, only a few minuts walk from Sultan Ahmet. 3) Complete breakfast. 4) Nice view from rooftop where we used to for tea/coffee. 5) Valued comments and tips that we recived to plan our daily schedule. 6) Clean room. and so more

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel in great location, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ozzie2010
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 day stay at the Asmali Hotel in June 2010. -The location is excellent, a 5 minute walk to the Bliue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace (there is also a great little bazaar behind the Blue Mosque). A further 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Many good restaurants nearby. Lots of interesting streets and lanes to explore... -The staff at Asmali are extremely helpful. -Rooms are small, very clean, with modern bathrooms. -Breakfast is an outstanding banquet of Western and local foods, on 5th level with option to dine on the rooftop overlooking the Sea of Marmara. -Great value hotel. -Be aware, stairs may prove difficult for the mobility impaired.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HistoryBuffStirling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in June (2 mature couples), before and after a trip to the coast. The owner and staff were excepionally helpful, welcoming and obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were not large but perfectly comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was abundant and varied. The location is ideal for anyone wanting to explore the historical centre on foot, and the tram is only 10 minutes away (for visiting the Walls, the Bosphorus ferries or connections to Ataturk Airport). All in all, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good service and a good price quality rate”
Reviews.Author: ErhanG
Reviews.Content: It's a very clean hotel, 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque (sultan Ahmet), double glass (not noisy), good breakfest with a view to the Marmara Sea and the blue Mosque, personel was very kind and they helped us with information. The hotel was renovated in 2007, quality of the building is good. Erhan G. from Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff couldn't do enough for you, Walking distance to most sites.”
Reviews.Author: scubajosh7
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has plenty of Character. The staff especially enus was very helpful. He ordered takeaway for us on a first night and gave us information about tours and sites to see. Breakfast was good and there is an area on the roof that you can sit which is nice. The rooms were clean but not that big as it advertises. The Mansion suite has small seating area inside and the Jacuzzi is a converted small bath fit for one. The area is great, short walking distance to all the major tourist sites and tram line. They pick you up from airport if you stay more than three nights. If you get a free pick up to the fish market area they do expect you to eat at the restaurant where they drop you off. Can't choose you own. Will be happy to stay here again if I come back to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: trixiebelles
Reviews.Content: Had a great three night stay at this hotel. Clean rooms, close to everything including the bazaars, historical sites, museums, etc. Staff are friendly and helpful. Mornings are wonderful as you do have the option of a good breakfast with lots to choose from. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Couldn't have been happier.”
Reviews.Author: thewonderofitall
Reviews.Content: There were a bunch of other hotels we wanted to stay at but they were all booked. We took a chance on this one, as there are so many concentrated in this area. When we arrived there, the owner was away, but within an hour he arrived and upgraded a smaller room into one of the bigger ones for no extra charge, without us even asking. So nice. The room was nice - not special, but not bad at all. Slept very well - quiet. The A/C worked, the breakfast on the roof was awesome! Nice view of the sea of Marmara. The guy that helped us with everything was also extremely nice. In such a crazy, bustling place it was very nice to feel relaxed at the hotel. Walking distance to The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi. Very serviceable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: InaPumpkinShell
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were completely pleased with this hotel. The staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable with a great location; breakfast was also delicious. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Jei
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at Asmali Konak (December/January) and the truth is, I had expected more after having read all the raving reviews on TripAdvisor. Overall, the hotel has some good points, esp. the location and the staff. The location is quite good â€“ the hotel is is located in a relatively quite side street, close to the Sultanahmet Square (about 10 minutes walk, slightly uphill when heading towards the square), with the major sights of Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, and a variety of cafes and restaurants. At the square, there is also a tram stop (which will most probably become your major transportation system, as it takes you to the Grand Bazar in one direction and to other to Eminonu, where the Spice Bazar is and from where you can access ferry boats, as well as get to the station Kabatesh , from where you take the funicular to Taksim) . The Hop On Hop Off Bus also leaves from Sultanahmet. The staff of the hotel is incredibly nice and polite. Check in and check out went smoothly; we were also allowed to leave our suitcases till 1:30 pm in the room, until our pick-up service arrived. Now, to aspects that disappointed us and made us feel we didnâ€™t get value for money. The hotel is three floors high, with rooms also in the basement. The terrace is probably the only floor with a good view. The rooms towards the front side have an ok-ish view, of other houses â€“ but the back side rooms really offer a depressing view, namely of a wall. The first two days, we were given a room on the ground floor, back side. The room was tiny, not enough space to even open one suitcase, very problematic to put two suitcases even standing upright. Nothing like the pictures. Only a bed, two nightstands, one closet (relatively large, with safe inside, drawer underneath), a TV, telephone. Not even a chair. You felt like in a cell. Plus, as it is on the same floor as the reception, you kept walking up by phones ringing and people walking by the room to get to their rooms. On request, we were relocated to the second floor, but again back side. It was slightly more quiet, but again, when people go up to the breakfast room (and this is really the fault of the guests), you usually hear them, talking loudly and almost stomping up the stairs. The room was slightly larger, but again facing a wall, and not providing space for a chair (this time we also had a DVD player). The bathroom tiny again, just enough space for one person to fit in (shower is not like in the pictures, no door to close, so floor gets wet). Only little space to spread out your toothbrush etc. (though there is a cupboard under the sink). The only mirror in room is in the bathroom, no dressing table in room. The paint of one wall in the room is coming off, probably due to dampness. We took a peak at the front rooms and they did seem larger and more attractive, definitely more spacious and airier. It seems unfair to be charged the same price for so different rooms. Now, the rooms were overall clean, though the toilet seats in both rooms did require some cleaning when we first checked in â€“ on both, there was something like dust (in any case, the toilet paper I used to clean the seats turned yellowish-brown). Luckily, we had Dettol Antibacterial spray with us. Hotel provides ample usual toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion). Towels are changed if you place them on the shower floor. Another bad aspect: bathroom shares air duct with bathroom of other room â€“ so you hear even the faintest noise from your neighborâ€™s bathroom. Breakfast is quite ok (but not as great as I had expected). The breakfast room is on the top floor, about 6 tables are provided, some tables have views of the top of the Blue Mosque. It is only if you go to the terrace that you get a view of the sea (but not something you do in winter). Breakfast menu: spread of 3 cheese-sorts, some salami, ham, 3 different olive types, jam, honey, butter, bread (really not nice bread â€“ but I think thatâ€™s the general sort of bread to be found), milk, yoghurt, cornflakes, cheese pastry, cakes, cookies, and some dishes prepared each day. Different teas, Nescafe, and cappuccino/espresso. However, the staff is extremely friendly, and if you need something, they seem very happy to provide it (we asked daily for omelet, others asked for their bread slices to be toasted). Overall impression: we would have been very happy had we had a less depressing and cramped room (or had we paid less for the room); the hotel has quite a good location, is quite clean, breakfast ok, and staff very nice. As it is, we were slightly disappointed and donâ€™t think it was such good value for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: selmah
Reviews.Content: We are a young family with three children between the ages of 11 and 5. We spent 4 nights in Istanbul at Asmali Konak Hotel, it is a nice hotel with very helpful and friendly staff, breakfast was nice with plenty of variety. I was surprised at how close to many of the major tourist locations it was, we didnt have to use public transport as restaurants and places of interest were walking distance. We stayed in 2 rooms both clean and reasonably spacious, on our final day in Istanbul our flight departed at midnight, the hotel staff kept our luggage safe and organised our airport transfer. We had a pleasant stay at Asmali Konak Hotel and next time we are in Istanbul we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Itâ€™s walking distance to several places like the Blue Mosque, the bazaars, tram station, Hagia Sofia Museum, Topkapi Palace, several restaurants, cafes and shops. AK is in a good location and would also be great for a female travelling solo. Hotel staff is friendly and there were no problems with checking in or out. The price paid was good for the room. We had a basement double room that was comfortable, clean and with a nice bathroom. Phone was out of order but I was offered the use of the phone in the lobby if I needed to make a call. Breakfast served on the terrace was delightful and you have a good selection of foods, coffee and tea. I am looking forward to my next visit to the city; will definitely staff at the Asmali Konak Hotel. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bagpuss090
Reviews.Content: Hi, Following reading through the reviews on this site, I thought the hotel sounded perfect for my trip. Although on arrival to the hotel my mother and I were informed the hotel was over booked and they would transfer us to their sister hotel. The made up stand and wait for 30 minutes for a driver to take us to the other hotel, even though we wanted to walk and it was just 5 minutes away. The sister hotel was little more than an up market backpackers and while that would have been an expensive for what it was option, it was not a suitable alternative for my mother. We requested a refund, they said they would put it back on our card and we left to go look for another hotel near by. The refund was never made on to my card - as we had paid through a reputable website for the booking, I have also tried through them, although todate have not had our money back - the hotel have cheated us. My thoughts on arrival to Asmalik Konak was it looked OK - the carpet was old and worn, but general appearance did not put me off. And I am sure they can be charming when they want to be, although please be warned you may loss your money.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Trip Advisor- another fine hotel youve got me into”
Reviews.Author: ruralguy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent small hotel especially if you want to avoid the big chain hotels. I picked it because of the trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Superb value. It is in a very good location 10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. Good service. A comfortable bed in a clean, pleasantly decorated simple room with a spotless bathroom. There are very pleasant, helpful staff both in reception and kitchen. We slept well after seeing superb ancient buildings and had very enjoyable breakfasts on a roof terrace overlooking the roofs of Istanbul down to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for relaxation but also visiting all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Pete
Reviews.Content: The Asmali Konak hotel was a great surprise for me, especially after reading some of the negative reviews on the site. It is a beautiful hotel, with great rooms (and bathrooms), greta breakfast, a wonderful terrace with panoramic views and perfect location. We stayed in one of the basement rooms, and, although these were a bit on the small side, they had more than enough space, they were very clear and, all in all lovely. Breakfast was a great experience, with multiple foods to choose from (both hot and cold, salty and sweet), and a large choice of drinks (although I personally would not recommend the juices). The breakfast staff always tried to prepare new things for us each day, so we alwyas ended up trying at least one new thing. The staff at the reception was again very friendly, with everyone being able to speak very good English and being very eager to help with advice whenever required. Another great point for this hotel is that it is situated so centrally in Sutlanahmet, having maybe one of the best positions there. It is both central as well as located on a quiet street, thus giving you an apportunity to rest. Let's not forget about the free parking which we enjoyed for the entire week that we spet there. On the downside, the walls are pretty thin, but I have not found that to be a problem at all. Overall, Asmali Konak was a great choice, giving more quality than expected for the money that we spent, and If I were to return to Istanbul I would definitelly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: HeidiSeekie
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel is. Excellent value, lovely rooms, very clean and safe. Location is very close to all the Old Town sights (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia etc), but still doesn't feel too touristy. Delicious breakfast in the morning with pastries, eggs, toast, eggs, cheese etc... and free tea or coffee any time. You can eat breakfast on the roof with great views of the Blue Mosque and of the Bospherous. The staff are extremely nice. Ufuk, one of the men at the front desk, was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I was a bit nervous when booking because of some unfavourable reviews on tripadvisor.com, but I had no problems of any sort. There was always hot water, and the room safe seemed secure. I will definitely stay at the Asmali Konak next time I'm in Istanbul, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “finally found the best place to return to”
Reviews.Author: eva-ecce
Reviews.Content: I keep coming back to Istanbul few times a year as a tour guide with my clients. It took long time to find the best compromise between location, price, comfort and quality of service. Staying in the Asmali Hotel changed all this into one sentence - no compromises needed at all. Close to the main attractions and yet staying in culturaly turkish area, nice, extremely clean and comfortable rooms, very pleasant start of the day on the terrace with excellent breakfast, always pleasant staff you can relay on even when some emergency happens. If this is a tour guide dream fulfilled, why the clients should have a different optinion? All my group evaluated the accomodation with 5 stars from 5 possible and for me it was one of the most pleasant working weekends I've had for long time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb.”
Reviews.Author: svenskjay
Reviews.Content: A real gem of a hotel. An excellent location - within five minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cistern & the Sultanahmet tram stop. Staff are really helpful & can't do enough. We stayed in the Mansion Room (no 401) which was very large - sitting area with TV and large wardrobe (with safe), good sized and comfortable king bed and the bathroom with bath/jacuzzi & shower. The room was spotless and we had fresh towels & toiletries every day. Breakfast was an excellent buffet - mostly cold with a huge range of dishes and fruit. The hot dishes were a type of pastry, tomato/egg/pepper mix and turkish sausage. Fruit juices and teas of all description plus coffee (espresso as well as Nescafe). As the weather was dry we used the roof terrace for breakfast - the Blue Mosque one side, the Sea of Marmara the other - just fantastic. We stayed for 5 nights and thoroughly emjoyed ourselves. We'd highly recommend this hotel for people who don't want the 'chain hotel experience' but something more authentic without compromising on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Istanbul - small and personal”
Reviews.Author: fionamceachran
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a friendly arrival once we reached the hotel. Joe was very helpful, giving us a map of Istanbul and explaining to us the trips we could take around Istanbul and the important sites we could see. We were upgraded to the Mansion suite which was very large, could sleep 3, and had a jet-bubble bath. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The double glazing kept out the 5am â€œsingingâ€� outside from the mosque. Each morning, on the top floor restaurant, was a wonderful buffet breakfast with cereal, tomato, cucumber, cheese, bread, jam, juice, tea, coffee, and the option of a cooked omelette. When sunny and warm, it was possible to sit on the roof, in the open air, with a view to the sea. The location was ideal, walking distance to the train, tram (Sultanahmet), Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and all other sites. To get to Taksim was very easy too, thanks to the tram, and the attached funicular. At all times the staff were wonderful and the hospitality was excellent. They even ordered pizza for us one night to be delivered, and booked a Hamam for us at a nearby bath. We highly recommend Asmali Konak for a wonderful stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RGLLondon
Reviews.Content: A good value b & b. It seems the rooms vary, ours was small but comfortable and clean and there was enough light to read by. One can escape the tv in the breakfast room by going to the very pleasant terrace. We found the staff friendly and helpful. There are plenty of places to eat nearby but beware of the fish restaurant just up the road, make sure you order from the menu. There is also a taxi rank very nearby but beware once more: if the driver does not put the meter on he will charge double the appropriate fare.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: INALI
Reviews.Content: Very bad setvice, unhelpful staff, very noise, no warm water, flirty staff. The room smelled smoke. The keys of your room are not safe, they hide the keys under a book and there is no staff there to make sure that the keys of your room are safe. Lazy staff. The rooms are not clean. A very bad experience, it is a maybe 1 star bed and breakfast hotel. The staff have extra keys to the saftey box

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, smoky rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller008
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and the smell of cigarette smoke penetrated the room and linens. Stay included buffet breakfast that was replenished sporadically, though if you asked for something specific they would try to accommodate. We used their airport service for both arrival and departure and it was efficient and on time both ways. The furniture was surprisingly worn and the safe was broken. The narrow stairs to the breakfast room at the top of the building could be considered a nuisance to navigate for some. Toiletries weren't abundant but the shower was large and clean. Staff was generally pleasant. Not a luxurious mansion as the name might suggest, but a small, budget b&b in the old part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RMSSCO
Reviews.Content: About all I can say for this hotel is the location is great and it was clean. It is only about a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. The staff of young men were extremely friendly and helpful. This is not a Turkish mansion (more like a small house) and at the most it is a 2 star hotel. The breakfast was adequate but on the fourth floor without an elevator. Navigating into the shower/tub was hard because it was so tall. I am 5'7" and the top of the tub came to the middle of my thigh and it was precarious getting in and out. Upon checking into the hotel we mentioned that we were tired and just wanted to go to the Basilica Cistern that day. No problem, their driver would take us. We ended up with the driver, tour guide and felt like we had been hijacked into a carpet store. Also, we just wanted to relax at the rooftop restaurant with a beer one evening. We didn't realize it was not open for anything other than breakfast. They did bring my husband two very small (no more than 8 ounce) beers and me two very small glasses of water. When we wanted to pay the tab we were told 20 Euros!! My husband acted like he didn't hear him and gave him 20 Turkish Lira and we were told this was "adequate." We felt like we were being ripped off. Also, there is no waiting area other than the front steps of the hotel. We did find an excellent kebab restaurant close to the hotel - Ayasofya Kebap Hause at #23 Kucuk Ayasofya Cad., the main street going into the Arasta Bazaar on the west side.

Reviews.Title: “The beauty of Istanbul was enhanced by the warmest, most personal, and dedicated manager & staff I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: turktraveler99
Reviews.Content: What a great value for the price! I have never experienced in my 30 plus years of travel a more friendly, family-like staff, dedicated to making their guest's stay as pleasant & enjoyable as possible. The manager (Erhan) even gave me his business card with his personal cell phone # on it in case I had any problems in Istanbul, not just for problems in the hotel, I was free to call him night or day, anytime, and he would send help. The room was cozy, clean, and very cool ac. One of the highlights for me was the amazing view from the roof where breakfast is served. Wow! The view, overlooking the Sea of Marmara is incredible. I was tempted to just sit there, relax, and enjoy the view for a couple of hours. Also, bravo to the kitchen staff, the food is very tasty. Whenever, there was any problem or question regarding my stay at the Asmali, the manager and entire staff bent-over-backwards to fix the problem or to answer my questions. I was there at the beginning of my 23-day adventure in Turkey, and had booked another hotel for the last part of my trip, when I was to return to Istanbul for my last 5-days in Turkey. I enjoyed the Asmali and its people so much, I canceled my reservations at the other hotel and rebooked at the Asmali for my second round in Istanbul. I highly recommend this place. It's five-minutes walk from the major attractions of Istanbul. I'll definitely be back at the Asmali next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Liispet
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel very much, great location, just 5 min to Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia, lot's of good restaurant around, quiet neighbourhood. Lovely breakfast on the roof terrasse. Rooms are clean and bright (I stay in the top floor suite). And most important, friendly staff! I had very nice stay in Istanbul. Liisa from Estonia

Reviews.Title: “Suberb service and makes you feel like part of a family!”
Reviews.Author: cleo_dagamarose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and from the moment I arrived to the moment I left, I felt very much at home. It was as if I was staying at my own house in Istanbul. The service was superior, the hotel was comfortable, the location was outstanding and the food was delicious. Do not think, just go! You will be happy that you did. Sincerely, Cleo Da Gama Rose

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value”
Reviews.Author: LondonSarah12345
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a few places in Istanbul during our trip around Turkey we knew that hotels in Istanbul can be very overpriced. We booked this hotel through lastminute and got a great deal - Â£40/ double, which is cheap for Istanbul. We were surprised by the good quality of our room (we've stayed in other places which were of a much lower quality for the same price). A few extra comments - The view was a brick wall - we didn't mind for the price. The furnishings were of a very good standard. The location was brilliant - you can see the blue mosque from the terrace. The staff were friendly and helpful. We booked our transfer to the airport with another travel company - and it was much cheaper than they offered in the hotel. You see transfers advertised all over sultanahmet so look around. Having been in Turkey for several weeks we expected the standard turkish breakfast but what was on offer at Asmali Konak far exceeded our expectations. Also, I would recommend the Yani Marmara in the evening - it's just round the corner from the hotel and had a great atmostphere - we smoked nargile and played backgammon - very typically turkish!

Reviews.Title: “Check which room you book!”
Reviews.Author: Gulliva
Reviews.Content: 1. The website offers a free transfer if staying 6 nights - which we did. When we enquired we were told we would have to pay. We used taxis arriving and leaving - much cheaper than the price offered by the hotel. Taxi rank just down the road so very easy. 2. We were asked to pay for the total stay when we arrived - even though the booking form said we were to pay at the end. This was very inconvenient and we later realised was because they thought we would leave. 3. The room we spent the first two nights was very small. Two people couldn't stand on the floor at the same time. No room for cases. One side of the bed was against the wall; the other was a metre from the window. The room was below street level and next to the office - so very noisy during the night when the night staff were conversing with their friends just outside the door. 4. The safe was unusable. 5. the fridge was unplugged. 6. The woman who did the breakfast and cleaned was a gem and breakfast was good. 7. The staff were OK. 8. We were moved to a larger and much nicer room after two nights which greatly improved our impression of this hotel. Take care when booking. 9. Terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Navman1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the first floor. It was very roomy and had a wonderful shower with lashings of hot water. There was no view, but the upside was that we weren't woken at dawn by the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque a short distance away. Double glazed windows also helped. On arrival, we were offered a free 1/2 day tour of Istanbul which we accepted gratefully. There was absolutely no pressure to order excursions through them. One of the duty managers, Ahmed (I think that was his name) was always very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was fine, with the usual Turkish breakfast fare, as well as cereals and toast. Fantastic views at breakfast. The only problem with the room was that the air conditioning turned off after about 20 minutes and as it was the weekend, they couldn't get anyone to fix it. The location in Sultanahmet was great...walking distance to the markets, the Blue mosque and plenty of restaurants with roof-top dining. Excellent free wireless internet and a book exchange.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, can't wait to go back for a longer stay.”
Reviews.Author: Azureen
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely and quite charming located in an historical area close to important landmarks. Very nice room, very clean, wonderful bed, nice bathroom and perfect air conditioning (important for us). A good breakfast was served. If you enjoy it you can drink a perfect Turkish coffee prepared by a lovely smiling lady and look at the extensive view on the Bosphore from the terrace. The hosts were most accommodating and helpful. A special mention for Ali and Erhan who acted like friends.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: timtimSingapore
Reviews.Content: I totally regretted booking this hotel although after having read so many good reviews here. Pls read my review before you act. Trust me! It totally dashed my honeymoon, and the prior good time we had in Greece. Turning up in Istanbul with this hotel made everything go south. Let me share my experience: 1. Pick-up did not turn up at airport. I had to beg some local there to use their mobile to call up the hotel. Then they conveniently got some partner who are there to pick other guests to pick us up, without even knowing our names. So can we trust him to board his transport? When we finally got to the hotel, staff- Ali did not bother to apologies, but blushed off saying that he is not a computer, he can forget things. (i.e. forget to arrange our pick-up). 2. The very next moment, Ali asked for full payment for our 4 nights stay (we have not even stepped into our room, still with him at reception). The bad stay only reaffirm my initial belief that they are not confident of their own hotel, they were afraid we would check out after 1 night. True enough! 3. They were so keen and eagar tro ask for full payment, but guess what! they owe my my change. I have to keep asking him for it and he just pushed it to another staff. Is this the right way? Finally we got back our change, but NOT in EURO, but in Lira and shortchanged!!!!!!!! 4. Safe in room can be moved, they are not fixed to the cupboard. Furthermore, you cannot operate it by pin code (battery compartments has melted mercury) I checked with Ali, he told me not to worry, his hotel is very very safe. Do you think you should feel at ease when its your 1st day, safe can be moved, and only operated by key (which you won't know if hotel has another set of the key). - see photos. 5. We booked the suite, but it turned out to me just like any normal room (Def. overcharged). Hot water only come on for 2-3 mins, then cold water will take over. Tables and chairs have cracks, we did not even dare to sit on them. Who knows the moneyminded hotel will ask us to compensate for any "damages". 6. Bathroom full of mosquitos and flies. (see photo) 7. Pillows provided can be as "slim" as a piece of paper, so i asked for 2 additional pillows. I was prepared to even settle for 1 since its a BnB hotel, knowing my expectation shouldn't be that high. Guess what! Ali told me he needs to check if the hotel has extra pillows, he will get back to me! To the very moment when i checked out, i did not hear from him regarding the pillows. 8. I agree with the other travellers who wrote that hotel staff were more keen to sell us travel package. 9. Although its a BnB, but guests should not be offered EXPIRED drinks in the fridge right? What more, a rusty bottle opener. (see photo) 10. Room door shows signs of past attempted break-in? (see photo) Overall, i can only conclude that choosing this hotel has total ruined my honeymoon, and i will strongly not recommend this hotel to anyone. I may be wrong, try it if you want, and correct me subsequently with your pleasant experience. (view my uploaded photos to see for yourself)

Reviews.Title: “Greeting from Singapore”
Reviews.Author: seenseen
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot for the hospitality provided during our 3 weeks stay in Asmali Konak The place is good..walking distance to almost everywhere a tourist want to be Breakfast provided is good Would definitely go back to Asmali Konak if I have the chance to go Istanbul again

Reviews.Title: “Go there!”
Reviews.Author: UncleMarvo
Reviews.Content: 4 nights. Try to book the suite, top floor, includes jacuzzi and plenty of space to work/play. Staff immensely helpful, I don't know what we would have done without them. Service 101%, and right in the middle of the "real" Istanbul. see www.fortescue.org.uk/istanbul.htm for more ...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LibraryGirlQatar
Reviews.Content: Our family - young child + teenager - stayed at the hotel in early April. The central location was great for walking tours and our room charming and comfortable. The hotel staff were wonderful and made our stay in Istanbul extra special; they suprised my daughter with a birthday cake on our last day! I would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone, with or without children, and would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: boncuk07
Reviews.Content: My experience at Asmali Konak was excellent. I stayed here in early May 2009. The staff was very courteous and went out of their way to help us out. Great value for the money. Breakfast included - very nice. Convenient location to all the sites in the Sultanahmet district. Everything within walking distance from the hotel. The rooms were charming and the bathrooms were modern and clean. Great views from the terrace! I would recommend Asmali Konak to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, taste of true Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CandMHitchin_Herts
Reviews.Content: We came to Istanbul for a long weekend of fun and culture. Our stay at the Asmali Konak (for 1 night) and its sister Aruna Hotel (for 2 nights) certainly made this a special trip. The hotel staff were charming, welcoming and nothing was too much trouble - even making us lemsips at midnight to help us over the colds we had upon arrival! The free upgrade to the Aruna was a wonderful surprise - where a beautiful room with jacuzzi bath awaited. Again, the helpfulness of the staff at the Aruna and personal level of service gave us a taste of true Turkish hospitality. We would recommend these hotels (especially the Aruna) to anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time as we were. Both are in fantastic locations too within a short walk of the Blue Mosque and all the main cultural attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong choice, Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Kiera01
Reviews.Content: Wrong choice, Very disappointed! After read good reviews on tripadvisor, Me and My friend booked the Asmali Konak for 4days. But we end up staying 1night and had to pay 2nights to leave this hotel. The room that we stayed for 1 night had many problems. - disgusting smell from a bathroom. - Very Small Room. - No hot shower. Hot water for only 3 mins then ice cold water came out from shower. - Low quality breakfast. The breakfast has a very poor quality. Cheap guesthouses around this hotel serve the better quality breakfast than Asmali Konak. Breakfast in this hotel is not worth for 80 Euros! - We are Annoyed by Hotel staff Who doesn't know differences between being friendly and being flirty! We are very disappointed after stayed 1 night and we found that aroud this hotel there are so many decent places which have a spacious double room, Clean bathroom, all time hot water shower and good guality breakfast for only 50-70 Euros! Just these places are not good at advertising themselves on the internet as Asmali Konak. We talked to a manager about all the problems about a room and told him we wanted to leave. Then a manager told us that he's gonna charge us for 4days although we styed 1 night. Then he offered a bigger room for a same price. But We decided not to take this room although they said it would be the same price as the room we stayed. Hotel staffs had turned to be extremly rude, after I made complains about a room. and We didn't want to ruin our holidays beause of this people. A Hotel manager said If we want to leave we have to pay for 2 days. We paid 2days to get out of this place. They said only quality people stay in their hotel. (So... Does it mean that people who stay in Four Season have a better quality? What a contradiction!) After We left this awful hotel, We found a very nice hotel with resonable price on the right beind of Aya Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place.”
Reviews.Author: MoFlo95
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place. The manager went out of his way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The room was rather spacious for European standards, though the bed was a bit small. We did run out of TP and towels our last day, but otherwise the room was clean and the service was good. They also serve an excellent breakfast. The location is super -- about a seven minute walk from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. And it's on a rather quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: Jayandpee
Reviews.Content: The owner has tried to make this hotel nice, but very poorly lighting makes the rooms look very sad. The reception is also very unwelcoming. Our first room was overlooking a scruffy yard and wasn't very nice. We moved to a better room. The breakfast is excellent. Overall I think I would chose a more central hotel - there are some lovely converted Ottoman mansions in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, clean hotel and ideally located for visiting historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: familyof3inmacedonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel. It was comfortable and clean and the staff were very helpful. We have a six month baby and the hotel provided us with a baby cot. and bedding We stayed in a triple room which, although not overly spacious, was enough room for a family with one small baby. Although the hotel has a small staircase up to the room and up to the restaurant, the staff were very accomodating and let us leave the pram downstairs. They also helped us up and down the steps from the hotel to the road everytime we went out and returned. The hotel is ideally located for siteseeing, a short walk up a cobbled street, a right turn through the Arasta Bazaar and you are right in the centre of the historic city - perfect ! We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's a perfect place - we hope to be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Nastrik
Reviews.Content: We had a rest in this hotel in the bigining of March. And we realy enjoed it! First of all, the hotel is situated in Sultanahmet near The Blue Mouscue and Aya Sofia - 5 minutes by foot from all sightings, 7 minutes to the tramvay station, 15 minutes by foot from Kapali Carsi Bazar and 20 minutes to Laleli. Hotel is not big, but very comfortable and clean. Stuff is very polite! The breakfastes are served at the panoramik terrase with an excelent view of the sea and The Blue Mouscue. Food is very fresh and well cooked! Rooms are well decorated and comfortable! I would like to say THANK YOU VERY MUCH for good service and your care!!! Hope to be back again. Anastasia

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Excellent value, service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Aussi2
Reviews.Content: The Asmali Konak Hotel was a great find. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help us. The rooms were very clean and had nice touches such as a new loofah in the bathroom and fruit in the sitting room. Breakfast was excellent with some hot food as well as a cold spread, beautiful fresh breadrolls and even honeycomb. It was served on the top floor in a lovely bright room and you could go up onto the roof top to enjoy a great view. They even provided binoculars! The location was great - easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia the Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace and even the Grand Bazaar (or hop on the tram for a couple of stops. One way to the Grand Bazaar and the other way to the Spice Market). Even though it was close to all the major attractions, the street was very quiet. And all this for an amazing price - the most inexpensive hotel we stayed in during our entire trip. A word of warning - it is a small hotel of 8 rooms and even though it was the low season, the hotel was full most nights. So don't wait too long to book as you may not be able to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, lovely room and extremely close to Haghia Sophia”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBat
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I loved the fact that the building and rooms were very different to any I have been in before. They room was very welcoming, especially after being out all day walking round Istanbul. On the day of our arrival, they gave us complimentary wine, a lovely fruit dish and a dessert. The staff were very helpful, and if we ever needed anything, they came to help us immediately. When you arrive and make the booking, they warn you of things in Istanbul to be careful of (over chrging at restaurants etc) and gave their mobile numbers so that if you ever get in a predicament, they would be there to help! The breakfast is nice, and certainly not limited! If you need food ordering, they will order it for you, or they have their own very nice restaurant. They also offer pick up from the airport. I will definitely be staying there again when I visit Istanbul this summer! Please contact me if you would like to know more. Rebecca

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: kamilalondon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Istanbul where we spent 3 days. It was our first visit of the city, and we had an amazing time! We loved staying at Asnali Konak Hotel, as it is located in the very heart of the old city, within 5 minutes walk of the major monuments and museums (Saint Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace...). The hotel is small, situated in a quiet street and run by a really friendly English-speaking staff: Erhan, the manager, welcomed us with many helpful advices, gave us his mobile phone number and was reachable anytime for any questions. Ali was also very nice, and did a great job to make sure we were comfortable at the hotel and advised us what museums to visit. Breakfast is served on the top floor and offers beautiful views of the city and the sea. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will certainly come back a second time!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: DingoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a business trip that took in a number of countries and thus lenghty stays in many hotels. I broke my return trip in Istanbul with the sole purpose of travelling to Gallipoli on Xmas Day. I expected to spend several days and nights catching up on some well over due rest and relaxation. The hotel is well appointed and the food and creature comforts is of a high standard. The stand out feature for the Hotel and it crowning achievement is the staff. Within literally minutes of being there I was made to feel at home and shown genuine care and kindness that you only ever receive from your family. I can truely say I was moved by the friendship that was shown to me and am already planning to return there in 2009 to once again spend time with these truely wonderful people. Insular.

Reviews.Title: “No Brainer - Book Now!”
Reviews.Author: svdtang
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel now! Before it is fully booked! This small boutique hotel is in a great location, in the Sultanahmet district and a short walk from the Blue Mosque. Super comfortable bed, new bathroom, great shower. Satellite tv with BBC worldwide, CNN, and a few other English channels. Great breakfast with fantastic views. When we arrived, we were exhausted so asked if we could order food in for our dinner and this was arranged for us quickly and with no problems. The hotel reception was very accommodating and arranged a walking tour for us and a visit to a hamman. They also provided maps and local information. We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of a two month trip and it was certainly a great way to end a fantastic holiday. Highly recommended - I wish more hotels were like Asmali Konak Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Turkish Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: mkyhnn
Reviews.Content: Asmali Konak Hotel is the best way to experience Turkish hospitality during your stay in Istanbul. Located in the heart of Sultanahamet, Asmali Konak is very near all the main attractions and is the perfect base for your stay in Istanbul. You can stay in three, four, or five star hotel anywhere, but Asmali Konak Hotel provides a unique setting for your holiday. The renovated mansion has only eight rooms and includes a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the sea. I spent four fantastic nights with my girlfriend. The quaint, traditionally decorated rooms are ideal for a romantic getaway. Everyone at Asmali Konak Hotel goes out of their way to ensure you have a perfect stay while in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Romantic Place”
Reviews.Author: jgelsis
Reviews.Content: The place that you wish to be yours... An excellent hospitality, a familiar place and a manager (Erhan) who is a really friend of all the tourists! A romantic room with traditional decoration! Thank you, for the moments that you gave us!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul - Asmali konak - a wonderful ottoman mansion”
Reviews.Author: angelintraining
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 15th , oct. to 20th , oct. The hotel is located in the very heart of old Istanbul. If you are intrested in sightseeing and the history of the city . It's one of the best places where you can stay in Istanbul .Most of the world-known sights of the city are here in Sultanahmet area. If you are on your business trip , be aware of a terrible traffic situation in Istanbul . The hotel is located in the historical part of the city but not in the business area. If you prefer small , cosy places to stay at ,Asmali Konak is your choice. The hotel was opened in 2007 , so the owner and the stuff take care of it a lot . Staying at the hotel you will find welcoming and hospitable attitude towards you. The front desk manager , Mr. Erhan , is always ready to help and advice the best solution . The atmosphere at the hotel , created by the stuff is extremely friendly . The restaurant , located on the top floor offers a good choice of meal for your breakfeast . There is an open top-floor veranda to enjoy the terrific views of the city . The rooms are of standard size , clean and cosy . There is no elevator at the hotel . Don't forget it's a former mansion built in 1946 . If you have any walking problems , book the ground and the first floor rooms. It's not my first time to visit Istanbul . The trip was wonderful as always . I'd like to thank you the stuff of the hotel as it's an extremely important point for your positive experience visiting the city . I was quite happy with our choice and mostly it's due to care of the stuff. Thank you a lot . See you again in Istanbul. Kendine iyi bak . Tessekur ederiz .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing care of the customers”
Reviews.Author: londonsatra
Reviews.Content: My fiance and me expend 4 days in Istambul on October, just as pleasure trip, and we decide to stay in Asmali Konak Hotel because we had the feeling that we can be really comfortable there. The experience was amazing, all the staff of the hotel was really friendly, especially Erhan that he gave as his personal telephone number in case that we had some problem and he can helped as. The conditions of the hotel are really good, we was in the suit room and the room was as we expected, nice and clean. The hotel is really well situated in the middle of Sultanahmed, just 5 minutes walking from Aya Sophia. When we will come back to Istambul for sure we will come back to Asmali Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Junama
Reviews.Content: AsmalÄ± Konak is located in a quiet street very close to Istanbul's main attractions in the historic centre. It is an excellent choice for travellers who appreciate the personal atmosphere of a small hotel. Our room was clean, the bathroom looked new. Room size was okay, but not spacious. Service was always friendly, individual and flexible. We (two female friends in the 30ies) spent four days in this hotel and felt safe and at home. The staff is warm, friendly and caring and we liked their good sense of humour. A great variety of food is offered for breakfast which you can have either inside or on the top terrace (nice view of Sultanahmet Mosque and Bosporus). The place has everything to make your stay pleasant provided you donâ€™t expect a four star hotel according to German rating standards. It was great fun staying there, and if we return to Istanbul, we will definitely choose AsmalÄ± Konak a second time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great People, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Saqash
Reviews.Content: The three of us stayed in a triple room in the second week of Oct 08 for 5 nights at Asmali Konak Hotel and here is our review: 1. The location is awesome! Only 10 mins walk from all the major attractions like AyaSophia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi Palace, Hippodorme and all.. not to mention the Tram Station (SultanAhmet). So the location is perfect for commuting around and as well as for anywhere in Istanbul! 2. The rooms are clean and cozy with tidy washrooms. The housekeeping is good enough and so is the breakfast that the hotel staff so affectionately takes care about. 3. What else, hm... great staff, very friendly, accommodative and supportive. Wonâ€™t turn your request down unless they donâ€™t have a choice! All of them are very considerate. Understand English to a reasonable extend so communication is fairly easy. Erhan Celik, the Manager, is very friendly, hospitable and accommodative so is Saadettin Ã‡eÅŸmeci, the owner would go to any length to help you. No matter how much you bother them! 4. The hotel has 8 rooms and is well provisioned and decorated. The view of the Marmara Sea as well the Blue Mosque from the roof is superb. 5. It provides awesome value for money and the experience was great! 6. Surely recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Three wonderful days in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: FrankySp
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting trip over the night we arrived late afternoon in Istanbul. According to the travelguide we had with us, the best hotels (konaks) were to be found in the Sultan Ahmed area. Our recommended hotel was full, so after a long walk through the city we found Asmali Konak. When we arrived there and had spoken with the owner, he insisted on showing us the room. After we had seen how beautifully it was decorated, it wasn't hard to decide anymore. Since our last visit to Istanbul almost twenty years ago, the city has changed unrecognisably in the positive way. Our stay at Asmali only confirms this impression. The friendly ambience, the hospitality of the owner, the central location in the city and the charm of the renovated quarter are all sincere recommendations for future stays. Friendly greetings from all of us from Macedonia ! :]

Reviews.Title: “Friendship...maybe for a life..:))”
Reviews.Author: csurke
Reviews.Content: What can I say...?It was a wonderful experiesion... When we found this hotel we was amazed first by the hotel and the room style................it was large,clean,pleasant.....and decorated in turkish style... After that ...and what we think that it was very important the ALL STAFF..........they are so friendly,hospitality,kindely...i cant found words to tell ,how excellent they were. We are sure about one thing...............if we will go to Turkey........we will visit this ,,friends'' For this ocazion we want to thank ,that we feel ourself like a member of this big family,which was the staff on the hotel Thanks.....CSABA & KINGA from Romania

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ckearton
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great central location and very helpful staff. I booked because I liked the sound of a Turkish mansion but was rather dissapointed with the actual hotel. The rooms were very small and we found them noisey. I have recommended it to others as it is in such a good location but with the proviso that they should be aware that the actual hotel was very ordinary. I had read the previous reviews and found them very flattering to the hotel. Our room had faulty electricals and the promised free airport pickup was charged for as we had booked through another website. This negativity should be balanced by the fact that Erhan, Ali and the rest of the staff were exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pass the breakfast. Hold the cigarette smoke ...”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2559
Reviews.Content: The breakfast at this hotel is definitely not to the standard of others. The orange "juice" is not actual juice, but squash, as is the cranberry "juice." The fruit did not look fresh and the omelette was the same each morning. The bread was good, however. The owner of the hotel smokes outside but the smoke follows him around. Our bags sat on the street for ages while a big conversation took place regarding which room we were to be in (and then, it required a plumber ... another story). I would not recommend this hotel to anybody especially at the price they charge. There are many other great little hotels in Istanbul that offer a superior breakfast, nicer rooms, and no cigarette smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul bliss”
Reviews.Author: cornish-fairy
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and cosy Turkish mansion with modern facilities including wireless internet access. Full of charachter the hotel is set in a peaceful area of Sultanahamet clsoe to all the best historical sites. Lovely atmosphere with boutique decoration, and a great roof terrace with wonderful views of the sea and the famous Blue Mosque. Accomodating staff provided the best of Turkish hospitality and helped make our stay thoroughly enjoyable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Marta_G79
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 night last April. They picked up for free at the airport and this is really nice to have when you arrive in a foreign country. We found the team always very polite and helpful.The breakfast was always a nice moment for sitting down and talk for a while...The hotel is in short walking distance from Aya Sophia and the other monuments that you can see also during an evening walk. The room is actually small but be found it extremely comfortable and perfect for a short stay. From the roof terrace there is a magnificent view of the City and the Bosphoros (we attach our picutres by night). Only a warning: nearby there are many nice small restaurants... avoid the "Boukoleon"!!! The food is average: the prices are way too high (we paid as if we were in a top fish restaurant here in Italy....) and not shown. They just treat you as a turist to rob.

Reviews.Title: “Great family-style home base near major sites”
Reviews.Author: Tim_and_Cat
Reviews.Content: Asmali Konak was a fine place to stay for our three day trip to Istanbul, and we would return. Keep in mind it is a bed & breakfast style hotel within a true older Turkish residential neighborhood, which you can plainly see from the windows, clothes drying on lines etc., people sweeping or sitting on steps. It is not "posh" or "five star corporate" so it depends on what a traveler is looking for. Asmali Konak is family-owned, new, clean, friendly, excellent & quietly friendly service plus easy walking distance to all the top major sites; in fact we also found & shopped the Arasta Bazaar right near the hotel was so much nicer, good prices, and less pushy than the Grand Bazaar. The breakfast felt like an authentic offering with good tea, cheese, olives, eggs, bread, but with some "American" choices on the opposite table (like cereal etc. which we are fairly sure most Turkish locals probably don't eat). Cool views from the roof. The hotel's transportation from the airport and then to the ship we were catching to Kusadasi was smooth and comfortable. We felt the owners really took care of everything, provided maps, information and orientation to where things are relative to the hotel. Wonderful people. Also want to applaud energy conservation: the lights only work with your room key placed inside a wall unit on the wall of your room, very good idea! Our only suggestion to the owners is: please figure out something for the front door in the morning. The door is locked every night with a key from the inside, which we appreciate, but one morning we woke up "early" to go for a walk (it was 8AM), and no one was at the reception to open the door. After waiting about 15 minutes, one hotel person came to unlock the door....other than that , we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very good !”
Reviews.Author: ArnoLille
Reviews.Content: Very nice hÃ´tel that i recommend. The location is great, really close walking distance to the main attractions of Sultanhamet in a traditionnal district. The hotel itself is good; a traditionnal boutique hotel with a lot of charme, rooms are clean with comfortable beds, decoration is quite typical 19th. The best of it remains the terrace on the top floor which has a wonderfull view on the Blue mosquee. You can have your breakfast there and enjoy the panorama. Breakfast is really fine, eggs and toasted sandwich, fruits, cakes, coffee, juices ... Staff&service is good, they can arrange everything you need. I will come back there !

Reviews.Title: “Home from home!”
Reviews.Author: nims
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul celebrating a special 40th B'Day with a group of 12 friends.We had booked 6 rooms at the Asmali Konak after reading other reviews on TA.We had booked the Mansion room 401,twin deluxe room 402,junior suite 301,deluxe doubles 302 & 202 and standard room 201.Room 201 had rather small double bed -ok for single person and window overlooking street level-slightly noisy, so our friends decided to move to 102 in basement -larger twin room with window. The owner/manager Saadettein was very friendly and hospitable and nothing was too much trouble! With prior notice, he had arranged a very nice lunch(slightly expensive!) specially for us being vegetarians and also a nice surprise Birthday cake!(Make sure you get a price per person if you are having lunch beforehand!) The rooms were all very clean and comfortable and be prepared for walking up and down stairs as the breakfast room and Terrace is right on top floor but worth the view!! Breakfast was average continental with some hot dishes on offer! The location is excellent,10 minutes walk to tram stop and 10 minutes from Blue mosque and Ayia Sofia.Grand Bazaar is not too far as well about 15 minutes away.The area is quieter and very safe to walk around even late at night! The staff-Erhan and Ali were excellent! Erhan gave us alot of information and was happy to book us taxis,restaurants,whirling Dervish show etc Ali was the comedian and kept us all well entertained with his stories! The friendliness,good humour and warm hospitality of all the staff made all of us feel as if we were at home!!
