All in all I would definitely stay here again if I came back to Istanbul and recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to Farewell”
Reviews.Author: OKAussie
Reviews.Content: With tears in our eyes, my husband & I bid a sad farewell to Asmali Konak staff. After 6 nights & attempts to rebook for the following month, we settled for a brief 'hello' on our return. They were all booked out on the dates we were to return. To the hotel itself:- We were upgraded to a suite because of the length of our stay. Which meant we had another room where a small table & 2 chairs were positioned along with a small desk & chair, a spacious wardrobe & small tv & bar fridge. We appreciated having the extra space. The suite was spacious (by Istanbul standards), clean & pretty Ottoman decor (by anyone's standards). The staff were beyond reproach. One helpful young man, walked us to the restaurant for dinner when we asked directions, some 15mins away. He refused a tip. Breakfast was delicious & they specially prepared your choice of omelette on request. Breakfast could be served on the rooftop if you preferred but it was cool the days we stayed in Istanbul so we ate in the dining room. The position of Asmali is great because you only hear a feint 'call to prayer' & its near to a choice of restaurants without being in a bussling surround. They have double glazing on the windows for added insulation. Its a small boutique hotel which basically means you get individual attention making it a unique place to stay in a very busy city full of demanding tourists like ourselves. Nothing was too much trouble for them to fulfill. The owner drove us around to inspect alternative accommodation for our return visit. While this 2nd hotel was nice, the staff were not as helpful as Asmali Konak.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Se
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Asmalia Konak for 5 nights based on the excellent reviews at TripAdvisor.com. We reserved a "suite" at 95 euros per night, which I was assured had a big bed, which is important to me as I am tall. Things didn't start off too well when we arrived tired from the airport at 7:30 pm looking forward to a rest, and were told that the room wasn't ready because of a late checkout. Although we ate on the plane, they suggested that we get some dinner. which we reluctantly did, and on returning at 8:20 we again found that it still wasn't ready. We were then bundled upstairs to the breakfast room and given a cup of tea to drink on their roof terrace, where we shivered for 10 minutes before coming back inside. We hung around the breakfast room till 9pm, and finally walked down to the room to see what was happenning to find it still being cleaned. Finally at 9:15 we got the room! We then realised that we had made a mistake booking here. The "suite" was no more than 24 sq metres (240 sq ft) including the bathroom with big, chunky furniture, so that with 2 suitcases on the floor there was hardly any room to walk around. There was also a faint smell of cigarette smoke, and at times the bathroom smelled musty. But worst of all for me was the bed. Far from being "at least 2.1 metres" (as we were promised) it was a small double bed, no more than 2 metres long (6ft 6in) with both head- & footboards. When I tried to stretch out, with my toes touching the footboard, my head hit the headboard. Needless to say I didn't sleep well that night. The next morning we found a much nicer hotel with a big room and large bed in a better location for the remaining 4 nights for 20 euros more, and worth every cent. To give them their due, the Asmali Konak didn't quibble when we told them we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in Spring”
Reviews.Author: ZUZEZ
Reviews.Content: Actually this is my third visit to Istanbul, but the first in Spring . And I am sure to say it's the best time to visit this magic city. The air is full of freshness and odour of roses. The Asmali Konak hotel being situated right in the historical center is the best place to stay at during your romantic trip. Having been to this hotel more than once, I can admit that every time I come here , I see something new introduced by the owner Mr..Saadettin. He and all the hotel staff do their best to make your stay here unforgettable.As my husbund had to do a lot of business the staff was always helpful to arrange a taxi or give a lift. Early morning breakfast was also of great help if we had to go to far away factories. But what I admired most of all was the quiet and calm atmosphere. Actually my stay ion Asmali Konak Hotel was great fun and I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: brianlearoyd
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay in an Hotel which lacks Turkish flavour but has an ambience of a typical International Hotel then dont read on. The Asmali Konak Hotel is a small Turkish family Hotel in a quiet location where my wife and I stayed for 7 days. We were collected by one of the family from the airport and in a short time introduced to the Proprietor - Saddettin - who was most helpful and reassuring. There are only 8 rooms and a breakfast room with a terrace that has wonderful views over the Mamara Sea and to the Blue Mosque. The location provides easy access to the main sites all within easy walking ditance. What made our holiday was the kind attention from this very pleasant Turkish family, a truly wonderful impression on our first visit, - we shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “All that we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: BJG1944
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel on the basis of its location and the extremely positive reviews recorded on TripAdvisor by recent guests. - and none of us in our party of four was disappointed. The location, in a quiet residential street, very close to shops and restaurants and not far from the Blue Mosque, was perfect. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble, and the rooms were modern, clean and well-appointed (including tea-making facilities that were not advertised on the hotel website). The breakfast buffet was also very good and taken in a pleasant room at the top of the hotel, but the wind was a little too cool for us to make use of the rooftop terrace although some of the other guests did so. The private car airport pickup service operated by the hotel (arranged direcly with the hotel by email) was comfortable and extremely convenient and at 30 euros each way for 4 people was excellent value. The owner/manager also arranged sight-seeing trips, including transport to the quayside for our boat trip (also good value). All in all an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PeePee1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in room 401; two separate three day stays at either end of our trip. Saadettin and his staff were friendly, and Saadettin was helpful with travel information and arrangements. The hotel's in a quiet neighborhood, close to many of the major sites in Sultanahmet but away from the noise and crowded streets of tourists and wall-to-wall hotels. Breakfast had many choices, cheese and omelets, and olives, and yogurt, and fresh fruit, as much as you want, and there's a great view from the terrace. Check it out... Paul and Geraldine, Brooklyn, New York

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Irinaz
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel in the historical part of Istanbul. Rooms are nice, rather spacious and clean. The open air breakfast terrace boasts a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque. Canâ€™t think of anything negative - a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, What More Can We Say ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl8
Reviews.Content: After a 6 week trip throughout eastern Europe, we can say our first hotel, Asmail Konak was the best....this small hotel over exceded the five star hotels. The room was outstanding with a sitting area that made it seem large and elegant. The location is perfect to see all the sights and we even received a complimentary tour of the city. The breakfast was outstanding. We can't give enough praise to Sodo and the entire staff. We were treated as VIPs and they all went out of their way to help us daily with everything. We would highly recommend staying at Asmali Konak. Carol Cottrell Dan Brajcich

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOHN61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned to England after six nights at this hotel. We can find no fault whatsoever. The owner and staff are all most attentive and extremely hospitable and kind. Our room was very clean and comfortable and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Transport was made available both from and to the airport, for which we were very grateful. The location close to the Blue Mosque is particularly good. We will be returning again. John and Anne Allen.( England)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel you need for a perfect holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TheAndieGirl
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful experience with Asmali Konak Hotel began even BEFORE we arrived there. I had a little problem with the room booking (done via a website) and Mr. Saadettin Cesmeci, the owner, helped me sort it out. In fact, he upgraded our room while at the same time gave us a discount! He also helped us arrange the transportation from/to the airport & hire a tourist guide, a car, and a driver. My family was very pleased with his recommendation (if you ever need a tourist guide in Istanbul, ask for Hasan Bozacioglu). Asmali Konak is perfectly located at the heart of Sultanahmet District. It's a 10-minute walk from Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and the Marmara Sea. A quick jog in the neighborhood is a wonderful way to start a day. The hotel consists of 8 rooms. The ones with balcony are facing another building behind the hotel while the ones without balcony are facing the street. The best view, however, is from the roof top where you can see the Blue Mosque and the sea. There is no elevator in the hotel. No need to worry about your luggages, though. The staff will help you carry your stuff upstairs. If you have problems climbing the stairs up and down, book a room on the lower floors. There reception area on the ground floor is very small. Thus, whenever we needed to wait for somebody, we had to wait in our room or the breakfast room upstairs. I stayed in room 302. The room is small but if you utilize all the closets and cabinets in the room to store your stuff, you will have more space. I shared the room with my Mom and Dad. Thus, we put an extra bed in the room. Additionally, each of us carried a medium size luggage and a duffel bag. We managed to fit everything in our room and still felt comfortable enough. We spent most of our time exploring the city anyway. The bathroom is small but clean and modern (the towels were changed every day). There is not much space to hang our clothes, though. I resolved the problem by using the cabinet under the sink to store the clothes. The water temperature in the shower is unpredictable. It could go from really cold to really hot. The trick is to do a quick shower while the temperature is "right." Breakfast is modest but sufficient. I don't usually eat much breakfast but surprisingly I ate too much every day I was in Asmali Konak. My favorite: warm baguette with honey and butter, fried spring roll with Feta cheese inside, cherry juice, Turkish tea (chay), Saadettin's omellete (yes, he prepared it himself), and fried potato/sausage mix (prepared by Saadettin's daughter). The staff are very friendly and helpful. They would go out of their way to help you. Saadettin is quiet man but the 3 words he utters the most are the ones that brought a big relief whenever I requested his help: "Yes, of course." It was absolutely great that we got to enjoy our holiday while somebody else took care of the other details. We stayed in Asmali Konak on March 17-21, 2008 and my parents are already talking about coming back. That is quite a compliment coming from my Dad (a demanding retired military general) and my Mom (a home goddess herself), both are avid travelers. As for me, I do what I think is the best compliment for Asmali Konak: tell the whole world about it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Turkish”
Reviews.Author: realopie
Reviews.Content: We spent most of the week trekking on foot through the largest snowfall in the city in two years but this hotel is wonderfully located for walking access to the major tourist sights in Istanbul. The room was perfectly clean, large enough to afford a sitting area with two comfortable chairs and a table for tea cups, magazines, etc. The bed was harder than I would prefer but that was my only complaint. We always had adequate heat and hot water even though the outside weather might have challenged most systems. The staff could not have been nicer. Desk help are fluent in English and the night clerk we interacted with was ravenous to learn more conversational American English. He keeps a notebook of words and phrases he recently heard on American TV shows and we had a great time working through the language idiosyncrasies with him. The hotel provided transportation on request to and from the airport at extra charge. This was a major benefit since the snowfall the night before we left required them to dig out the van from in front of the hotel. The driver was excellent. The breakfast was always the same but it is more varied than most local hotels and is adequate to get you fueled up for the day. Be sure and try the Boukoleon Fish Restaurant just up the block for a beautiful view of the Sea of Marmara and as good a meal as I have ever enjoyed anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “10 plesant days in Asmali Konak”
Reviews.Author: heragirl
Reviews.Content: I got back last week from 10 pleasant days spent in Istanbul at the Asmali Konak Hotel. The owner Saadettin is very kind and helpful, the room is full of character and comfortable. I had a good night's sleep there in the quiet and friendly neighborhhood of Sultanahmet. I could walk to most of the sights, otherwise a tram was nearby for further exploration. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a small hotel with lots of atmosphere -good breakfast too and a great roof terrace to admire the cityscape from!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Vraagteken
Reviews.Content: We had to be in Istanbul partly for pleasure and partly for Business. After a long search of hotels we came via tripadvisor to the asmali hotel. It is a small hotel not far away from the blue mosque and the hippodrome. ( 5 min) Our room was bigger than the standard rooms in other hotels and all was very clean and had nice furniture. The service of the hotel is excellent. One day I was to a meeting about 15 km from the center and my wife got sick. They threated her very kindly, made thee etc. An other evening I had a dinner in the other hotel. They insisted to bring her by car to the hotel because off safety. We would recommend this hotel because off his service, rooms, price and location. I would advise to let them pick you up from the airport like we did. I saves money and much time. We wish you an nice stay in Istanbul. Dejan and Veroni Savic

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: OzWanderer71
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff were absolutely fantastic. The breakfast on offer each morning offers something to please nearly everyone. The location is perfect, just 5 minutes walk to two of the most famous mosques in Istanbul; Sultanahmet and Ayasofia. Overall a perfect first point of contact for any stay in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leasreview
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an absolutely perfect stay at this delightful and charming hotel. Before anything else I would just like to say an enormous 'thank-you' to all those at the hotel for making our trip so special! What makes it so wonderful? Well, where to begin? The owner, Saadettin and his staff made us extremely welcome. They were happy to spend time talking with us on an evening over tea, offer us help and guidance and book restaurants and events for us too. The location is ideal as it is literally 5 minutes walk to 2 of the most famous sights- The Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia, however, as it is located on a quiet side street, that is well lit and clean, in a friendly neighbourhood, you are able to relax and get a very peaceful night's sleep. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable and are attended to every morning with fresh towels provided. Upon arrival we found a lovely plate of fresh fruit and dessert awaiting us, which was a very pleasant surprise. There are tea and coffee facilities in the room and these are amply stocked with lots of different teas. The free transfer from the airport is also excellent too, and waited over an hour for us with no complaint. Breakfasts are appetising and offer a wide range of choice, from cereals to scrambled eggs and hot food, through to the more tradiional Turkish fayre of olives, cheese, jam and bread, all of which was delicious and in plentiful supply. The staff also cooked us an omelette each morning, without us even having to ask! In addition to the above, what makes this hotel such a wonderful place to stay is the fact that you are treated as so much more than just an anonymous traveller. At the Asmali Konak you are a very welcome and welcomed guest, and made to feel that you are valued. I have stayed in 5 Star Sandals resorts in the Caribbean, and 5 star hotels in London, but never have I been made to feel as welcome, cared for and as special as I was here. Saadettin and his staff cannot do enough for you- he even posted our postcards when we ran out of time! He is a most kind and generous host, who also has excellent taste, so if he recommends any restaurants, then I recommend you follow his advice! Ender- one of the night staff- made us cups of tea and chatted with us when we came back and told us lots of interesting things about this wonderful country and the city of Istanbul. The warm tea and friendly chat was especially welcome after a long day out. It snowed heavily while we were there, and we were always grateful to come back to our warm romantic rooms. I would thorughly recommend this hotel to any one who wants to stay in comfort, feel very special and looked after, and who, most importantly, wishes to experience true Turkish hospitality, and to not just be an anonymous guest in a impersonal chain hotel. Istanbul is a magical and exciting city and The Asmali Konak is definitely the place to stay. I will certainly be returning very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended special Sultanahmet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgetown83
Reviews.Content: The Asmali Konak Hotel is a splendid place to stay within the historic district of Sultanahmet, Istanbul. Unlike most of the other Sultanahmet hotels, the Asmali Konak is located in a quiet residential area away from ceramic shops and carpet stores. However, you will still be close by to all the historic sites (and shops); but you will be spared the sometimes unnerving experience of running the gauntlet of hard working merchants dedicated to the tourist trade every time you leave or return to your hotel. The Asmali Konak is a recently (1 year ago) rebuilt family house that stands in a row of family dwellings that date back to the 1940s. The conversion has been done sensitively to create an intimate hotel of just 8 rooms. The hotel's website (http://www.asmalikonakhotel.com) gives you a good idea of how most of the rooms look like. However, the website does not include pictures of the two single rooms. I have discussed these singles below and you can see my pictures of them here as well. The double rooms are spacious by Turkish and European standards. American travellers used to the sizes of motels back home may find these rooms smaller than what they are familiar with. Two of the double rooms face a lightly travelled road. The other four double rooms face the next house. The advantage of not having a street view is that you will not be woken by the 5.30 am call to prayers issued every morning by the mosques in the neighbourhood. (By the way you can see the dome and minarets of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room.) The double glazing on the windows muffles most of the street noise for the rooms that do face the street. It is a quiet street with only the noise of the occasional passing car. Traffic stops after about 10.30 pm. The families who live along the street go about their chores silently... there is a small playground at the end of the street and the children who play there are some the most well behaved I have seen anywhere. The double rooms are suite-like in providing a discrete seating area away from the bed(s) and bathroom. I recommend Room 201 to single travellers. It's a cosy room that receives good connection from the free hotel WiFi. I managed to stay in touch with my colleagues around the world right through my 11-day stay, thanks to their stable WiFi. The only "comment" one may have about Room 201 is that the glass-panelled shower stall does not have a door. As a result the floor of the bathroom does get damp. It's an easy problem to fix. Just lay your bath towel on the floor (like a rug) after your shower and the floor will be dry again in no time. I stayed in Room 101 for three nights. It's a nice enough room. It is what's called a "promotional room" in Istanbul. It's small and only suitable if you do not travel with a large suitcase. There's not much spare space for you to place big pieces of baggage here. The impressive feature about 101 is its bathroom which is large and well designed. The bed is placed right beside the windows which open out to the street level. You will see the wheels of cars parked outside if you were to stand in front of the windows and look out. The street noise however is manageable, and the neighbourhood does go still after midnight. The sounds that may bother you in this room come from the hotel office which is right outside its room door. Towels were in ample supply throughout my 11-day stay. The house keeping was first class; thanks to the very capable and gracious housekeeper. She also makes the hearty breakfast in the mornings for the guests. Breakfast is a very consistent offering of scrambled eggs, sausages, and mini cheese rolls. The house keeper will make you a special omelette is you ask for it. She is also wonderful in offering every guest a basket of fresh hot toast. There is an endless supply of Turkish tea and instant coffee. The Asmali Konak is also special in that it has a small espresso machine where guests can percolate their own fresh cup of caffeine if Nescafe is not your preferred brew. The hotel is very efficiently managed by its director, Mr.Saadettin Ã‡eÅŸmeci (Email: <[--]> or <[--]>). He speaks fluent English and is most prompt with his replies to emails. If you are staying for more than three days, the hotel may offer to meet you at the airport upon arrival if you are flying into Attartuk. The person who will meet you is most likely Mr. Saadetttin's nephew. He does not speak English but is a most gracious man. In one of the pictures taken outside the hotel after one of the rare snowfalls in Istanbul you will see Mr. Saadettin on the left with his cousin next to him. I am happy to recommend the Asmali Konak Mansion to you for a comfortable stay in one of the most authentic residential quarters of historic Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Review from Korea”
Reviews.Author: jdrules
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay in Instanbul! I had a great time and appreciate the kindness from the manager in Asmali Konak. I also had a lovely breakfast every morning and the place is located at Sultanahmet district so it only took me 5~10 minutes to walk to the popular sigtseeing places. If I have a chance to visit Istanbul again in the near future, I have no doubt that Asmali Konak would be my place to stay at. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not trustworthy! Be careful...”
Reviews.Author: Susanne_Hansen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and well located but... be careful! We were cheated: someone told us that we could not get our room because there was a problem with the pipeline and the truth was that it was sold to another couple!!! I would not trust them again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: paschalitsa
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 guests staying in this hotel. I could not be there to show them my home town and a bit of our hospitality. But I was almost sure that my Italian friends would feel like home. The feedback I received from them was very positive: The personnel was very friendly and helpful, they provided my guests with a mobile phone number in case they would have any bother... Further more the hotel personnel has helped me in a great way to organize a few surprises for my guests. And this at no charge. I will recommend further this hotel to my friends, it is very well located (and I can judge it as a local ;) And if one day, I will not have accomodation in Istanbul, maybe I will their guest too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Asmali Konak”
Reviews.Author: KitkatSingapore
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Asmali Konak. The owners are passionate about their hotel and will go out of their way to make our stay comfortable and safe. When it was raining they offered us their umbrella and upon arrival they provide us with maps and info. The hotel is clean, newly renovated and very conveniently located just behind the blue mosque. You can walk to all they key tourist sites, like Hagia Sophia, the Canals, blue mosque and shopping too at the Grand Bazaar. Even the housekeeper is absolutely pleasant and truly concerned about the guests. This is truly a great value for money pension and the breakfast spread is wonderful. Highly would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Made very welcome at the Asmali”
Reviews.Author: Randy001
Reviews.Content: We recommend the Asmali Konak particularly if you do not like faceless,expensive "international " hotels. It is well placed - five or so minutes -for all the key sights in the Sultanahmet area .The streets here feel a little "run down" but do not be put off.The hotel itself is small and the owner ,Saadettin, made us feel welcome straight away. He did many things during our short stay to help us and make us feel special guests.Great bloke.There is no lift so if you do not like climbing stairs this is not the place for you -but they have ground floor rooms too.Istanbul is so large we were not sure where to eat .So Saadettin arranged for us to be taken to a fish restaurant;this worked very well -we were picked up from the hotel and driven back - free! The meal was tasty and inexpensive & in a place we would never have found or thought to go to - very lively with local musicians who you were not pressured to tip either!Our room was very comfortable -especially the bed -and clean.The lady in the breakfast room was also very sweet and kind ;she realised we like toast so kept it coming..and made us an omellette on our last morning!

Reviews.Title: “Winning hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: fishy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during the off season in Istanbul. It is a well run establishment and the hotel staff is exceptionally friendly/helpful. The rooms are small-ish but the location of the hotel, the staff service, free breakfast and internet make the stay a very positive experience. If you visit this hotel, don't forget to check out the rooftop terrace with an excellent view of the sea on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Kelkonk
Reviews.Content: Asmali Konak is fairly attractive for two main reasons: first, a staff indisputably friendly, helpful and welcoming (above average); second, a great location - few steps from Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia, quiet little street. Rooms and especially bathrooms are very clean and well-kept. The downside remains their size: for a 4 stars hotel, the suite we stayed in was quite small. Breakfast is honest, fresh and good. without being a banquet. Overall view: a charming place to stay in. I believe too pricey during high season, but definitely nice during low season.

Reviews.Title: “nice hospitality, good location”
Reviews.Author: MilanoOzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Asmali Konak from 30/12/07 to 3/1/08. The hotel is confortable and there is a good relation between price and quality. Rooms are tiny but clean. Personnel is kind and helpful. Location is good, in a quiet corner, just behind the Blue Mosque. Definitely a good choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Asmali Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya mah. Mustafa Pasa sok. No: 57 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
